column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=To be a civil libertarian to affect individual rights in a positive way .
#Text=Why ?

#Text=As far back as I can remember I have always had an innate belief in what I now would call individual rights , equal justice , due process , and it came out in my family experiences and in my experiences in school as a young child .
#Text=What family experiences ?
#Text=I should n’t say so much direct experiences — well , to some extent — but the stories I was brought up on as a kid .

#Text=My father was a holocaust survivor and my mother ’s father was a protester during World War I when he came to this country as an immigrant , and he was literally spat upon for not going to fight in the war .
#Text=His official sentence for being a conscientious objector was to be forced to stand against the courthouse in Hudson County , New Jersey so that passers-by could spit on him .
#Text=What were you taught about him ?
#Text=I knew him as a kid and he told me these stories , and my mother told me , and it was very upsetting to me , but very inspiring to think about trying to rectify injustices .

#Text=When I say my own family , my own personal experiences are so trivial compared to those , but having teachers not allow different viewpoints come out in class and seeing kids tormenting other kids that were different .

#Text=When I got a little bit older there was an experience with a teacher who was exposing students to different viewpoints about the Vietnam War , and there was a call for him to be fired and he was editorialized against ; I led a campaign to defend his free speech rights , and our free speech rights .
#Text=Once I had the idea that I could go to law school to get professional skills to advocate for values that I had always believed in , it just seemed the right thing to do .
#Text=There are many other paths , I realize , but it certainly has been a good path to try to work with the values I care deeply about that I have had throughout my whole life .
#Text=When you went to Harvard , were you an activist on campus ?
#Text=Not so much .
#Text=I should say , I was an activist , but it was n’t like I was a leader of something .
#Text=Probably because I was involved in so many organizations and I was glad that I was exploring so many different forms of activism .
#Text=In college I was involved in the anti-war movement , and I was very involved in the women ’s movement .
#Text=Reproductive freedom was a really big deal then ; it was before Roe vs. Wade .
#Text=I remember there was a very high profile prosecution of a doctor for performing an abortion in Massachusetts , where I was in college .
#Text=Then in law school I was very active in a lot of organizations .

#Text=I was n’t sure of which direction I actually wanted to go , including prison legal assistance project , the voluntary defenders , the legal aid bureau…and I was also earning my way through law school so I had to do a lot of work .
